superficial.translation[0].definitions[0: not studying or looking at something carefully and only seeing the most noticeable things
Naturally, such visits can allow only the most superficial understanding of prison life.
Even a superficial inspection revealed serious flaws.
superficial.translation[0].definitions[1: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real
Beneath his refined manners and superficial elegance lay something treacherous.
Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
At a superficial level, things seem to have remained the same.
superficial.translation[0].definitions[2: affecting only the surface of your skin or the outside part of something, and therefore not serious
She escaped with only superficial cuts and bruises.
superficial.translation[0].definitions[3: someone who is superficial does not think about things that are serious or important â€“ used to show disapproval
All the other girls seemed silly and superficial to Darlene.
superficial.translation[0].definitions[4: superficial changes, difficulties etc are not important and do not have a big effect
superficial.translation[0].definitions[5: existing in or relating to the top layer of something, especially soil, rock etc
